title: Ticket #5756: startds locking up after condor_reconfig
description:
I did a pool-wide condor_reconfig earlier today, and eight startds failed our icinga condor_ping check (which is a condor_ping -name XXXXX -type startd READ). The condor_pings were hanging indefinitely.

I logged onto one one of the execute nodes; The StartLog looked like this: 

06/28/16 11:50:11 (D_ALWAYS) Got SIGHUP.  Re-reading config files.
06/28/16 11:50:11 (D_ALWAYS) History file rotation is enabled.
06/28/16 11:50:11 (D_ALWAYS)   Maximum history file size is: 20971520 bytes
06/28/16 11:50:11 (D_ALWAYS)   Number of rotated history files is: 2

Nothing after that; I did a strace on the condor_startd process and it was blocking on a read on file descriptor 3, which turned out to be a FIFO pipe.

40 minutes later the condor_master noticed that the condor_startd was hung and killed it. From the MasterLog (starting at the condor_reconfig SIGHUP): 

06/28/16 11:49:58 Sent SIGHUP to CKPT_SERVER (pid 2062075)
06/28/16 11:49:58 Sent SIGHUP to SHARED_PORT (pid 2062073)
06/28/16 11:49:58 Sent SIGHUP to STARTD (pid 2062074)
06/28/16 11:59:21 SECMAN: Succesfully sent DC_SEC_QUERY classad to <128.105.245.67:51558>!
AuthorizationSucceeded = true
06/28/16 12:09:21 SECMAN: Succesfully sent DC_SEC_QUERY classad to <128.105.245.67:57264>!
AuthorizationSucceeded = true
06/28/16 12:19:21 SECMAN: Succesfully sent DC_SEC_QUERY classad to <128.105.245.67:29656>!
AuthorizationSucceeded = true
06/28/16 12:29:01 ERROR: Child pid 2062074 appears hung! Killing it hard.
06/28/16 12:29:01 Sending SIGABRT to child to generate a core file.
06/28/16 12:29:02 DefaultReaper unexpectedly called on pid 2062074, status 6.
06/28/16 12:29:02 The STARTD (pid 2062074) was killed because it was no longer responding
06/28/16 12:29:02 Sending obituary for "/usr/sbin/condor_startd"
06/28/16 12:29:49 restarting /usr/sbin/condor_startd in 10 seconds
06/28/16 12:29:59 Started DaemonCore process "/usr/sbin/condor_startd", pid and pgroup = 1236624

The condor_startd came up and immediately went into the same state; Below is the StartLog starting from when it was killed by the condor_master process: 

Stack dump for process 4127775 at timestamp 1467136017 (16 frames)
/usr/lib64/libcondor_utils_8_5_5.so(dprintf_dump_stack+0x12d)[0x7f5c0b1373ed]
/usr/lib64/libcondor_utils_8_5_5.so(_Z18linux_sig_coredumpi+0x40)[0x7f5c0b1e6d70]
/lib64/libpthread.so.0[0x38c0c0f7e0]
/lib64/libc.so.6(__read+0x10)[0x38c04db500]
/lib64/libc.so.6(_IO_file_underflow+0x138)[0x38c0471ce8]
/lib64/libc.so.6(_IO_default_uflow+0xe)[0x38c04737ee]
/lib64/libc.so.6(_IO_getline_info+0xaa)[0x38c0467eca]
/lib64/libc.so.6(fgets+0xa9)[0x38c0466d29]
condor_startd(_ZN10StarterMgr11makeStarterEPKc+0xb0)[0x435060]
condor_startd(_ZN10StarterMgr4initEv+0x135)[0x435335]
condor_startd(_Z18finish_main_configv+0x7c)[0x43ee7c]
/usr/lib64/libcondor_utils_8_5_5.so(_Z16handle_dc_sighupP7Servicei+0x19)[0x7f5c0b1e99a9]
/usr/lib64/libcondor_utils_8_5_5.so(_ZN10DaemonCore6DriverEv+0x94e)[0x7f5c0b2022fe]
/usr/lib64/libcondor_utils_8_5_5.so(_Z7dc_mainiPPc+0x1799)[0x7f5c0b1e8f09]
/lib64/libc.so.6(__libc_start_main+0xfd)[0x38c041ed5d]
condor_startd[0x423569]
06/28/16 12:47:09 (D_ALWAYS) ******************************************************
06/28/16 12:47:09 (D_ALWAYS) ** condor_startd (CONDOR_STARTD) STARTING UP
06/28/16 12:47:09 (D_ALWAYS) ** /usr/sbin/condor_startd
06/28/16 12:47:09 (D_ALWAYS) ** SubsystemInfo: name=STARTD type=STARTD(7) class=DAEMON(1)

06/28/16 12:47:09 (D_ALWAYS) ** $CondorVersion: 8.5.5 May 03 2016 BuildID: 366162 $

06/28/16 12:47:09 (D_ALWAYS) Using config source: /etc/condor/condor_config

06/28/16 12:47:09 (D_ALWAYS) config Macros = 509, Sorted = 509, StringBytes = 68724, TablesBytes = 18476
06/28/16 12:47:09 (D_ALWAYS) CLASSAD_CACHING is ENABLED
06/28/16 12:47:09 (D_ALWAYS) Daemon Log is logging: D_ALWAYS D_ERROR
06/28/16 12:47:09 (D_ALWAYS) SharedPortEndpoint: waiting for connections to named socket 5325_15e7_53
06/28/16 12:47:09 (D_ALWAYS) DaemonCore: command socket at <128.105.245.104:9618?addrs=128.105.245.104-9618+[--1]-9618&noUDP&sock=5325_15e7_53>
06/28/16 12:47:09 (D_ALWAYS) DaemonCore: private command socket at <128.105.245.104:9618?addrs=128.105.245.104-9618+[--1]-9618&noUDP&sock=5325_15e7_53>
06/28/16 12:47:09 (D_ALWAYS) ioctl(SIOCETHTOOL/GWOL) failed: Operation not supported (95)
06/28/16 12:47:09 (D_ALWAYS) You can safely ignore the above error if you're not using hibernation

I did an strace on condor_startd; It's blocking on a read of file descriptor 10: 

[moate@e304 ~]$ sudo strace -s 8192 -v -p 1046624
Process 1046624 attached - interrupt to quit
read(10,

Which lsof shows is a FIFO pipe (again): 

[moate@e304 ~]$ sudo lsof -p 1046624 | grep -E '10[ru]'
condor_st 1046624 condor   10r  FIFO                0,8      0t0 320627850 pipe

I spoke verbally with TJ Knoeller about this issue; He thought it was related to the shared port daemon. Here is a sample of the recent shared port daemon log: 

06/28/16 14:45:22 SharedPortServer: server was busy, failed to connect to 5325_15e7_3 as requested by SHADOW <128.104.255.232:51996?addrs=128.104.255.232-51996&noUDP> on <128.104.255.232:35922>: No such file or directory (err=2)

TJ recommended doing a restart of the master; I'll append the result to this ticket.
remarks:
2016-Jun-28 15:48:13 by moate:
The core dump of the startd was too large too attach. Let me know if you want it.

-Moate
